title: What Happens After You Die?
verse: And just as it is appointed for man to die once, and after that comes judgment,
explanation: Everyone dies, and then we face God. It's important to think seriously about eternity.

title: Do You Think You're a Good Person?
verse: There is a way that seems right to a man, but its end is the way to death.
explanation: Many people think they're good, but we must compare ourselves to God's standard, not our own.

title: The Mirror of God's Law
verse: Therefore no one will be declared righteous in God's sight by the works of the law; rather, through the law we become conscious of our sin.
explanation: God's Law shows us we've sinned. It's like a mirror, revealing our true condition.

title: Guilty of Breaking the Law
verse: For whoever keeps the whole law but fails in one point has become guilty of all of it.
explanation: Even one sin makes us guilty before a holy God. We all need forgiveness.

title: The Penalty of Sin
verse: For the wages of sin is death, but the free gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord.
explanation: Sin earns us death, but God offers eternal life as a free gift through Jesus.

title: God's Love for Sinners
verse: But God shows his love for us in that while we were still sinners, Christ died for us.
explanation: God didn't wait for us to clean ourselves up. He loved us even in our sin.

title: Confess and Believe
verse: If you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead, you will be saved.
explanation: We are saved not by works but by trusting in Jesus and declaring Him as Lord.

title: Call on Jesus
verse: For everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved.
explanation: Anyone who calls on Jesus in repentance and faith will be saved.

title: Repent and Turn to God
verse: Repent therefore, and turn back, that your sins may be blotted out.
explanation: Repentance is turning away from sin and turning to God with all your heart.

title: Saved by Grace, Not Works
verse: For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God.
explanation: Salvation is a gift we receive through faith—not something we can earn.

title: Your New Life Begins
verse: Therefore, if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old has passed away; behold, the new has come.
explanation: Following Jesus means a changed heart and a new life with Him.

title: Buried and Raised with Christ
verse: We were buried therefore with him by baptism into death, in order that, just as Christ was raised from the dead… we too might walk in newness of life.
explanation: Baptism represents dying to sin and rising to a new life in Jesus.
